instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PM_SLP_SUS_L:
What is PM_SLP_SUS_L? 
The "PM_SLP_SUS_L" signal in a MacBook is related to the power management of the device, specifically concerning the 'suspend to RAM' state or S3 state. It's an active-low signal that, when asserted (low voltage), indicates the system should enter or is in the S3 sleep state. .
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage... missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
hi... iam tryning repair a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with water damage....i fix green orange light chande smc and J9500 with corrosion, now i have a nice green-orange in the charger....

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.    8,59v
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>.   3,42v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>.    3,3v
pp5vs4rs3.  0.00v
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>  0.00 v no short to ground....when remove <RESISTOR>R7551</RESISTOR> i have 5.100v in pp5vs4rs3 so <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> is good
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL>. 3.3 v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>. 0,0 v. <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_SUS_L</SIGNAL> missing and not short to ground
to remove j9500 use air station below logicboard ..... that may be the cause

please help

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage... missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
What about <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL>?
Be sure to use original Magsafe 2 charger.

Also check PCH's RTC signals.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage... missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
ok same news.....i apply hot in pch with air station at 180º and flux amtech.......now fan spin chime and boot in to os
there is another problem in the logicboard... no keyboard and tradpad
i probe another good keyboard and flex cable and tradpad but nothing....any idea pleased

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage... missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Looks like accumulated crap underneath CPU/PCH.

TP/KB work before macOS login?
Try to access boot menu...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage... missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: sometimes I can see the light of the shift keys before login ... I have even been able to type in the login but I have not been able to enter the boot menu by pressing the alt key...now it doesn't work anymore

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage... missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
TP talks with PCH in USB mode, before enters to macOS.
Once logged in, SPI mode is used.
So you must confirm if both ways bad, or not.
Access macOS with external keyboard and check.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage... missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Although it seems incredible, I do not have a USB keyboard here now .... I am on vacation ... but I have used an arduino per USB configured as a keyboard ... and if the arduino writes in the login

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage... missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: I have measured something in j4800 ... pin 2 <SIGNAL>TPAD_SPI_MISO_R</SIGNAL> is 0.0 v .. this pin is output ... shouldn't it measure 3.3v?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage... missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
ok correccion...
i get a usb keyboard. login in to os x with usb keyboard and TP/KB dont work
KB/TP dont work before and after login os x...dont work to enter boot menu

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage... missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Check voltage on pins 1/19 of J4800.
Also post <CHIP>U4810</CHIP> voltages, before and after entered OSX.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage... missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
ok i fix the problem...there was two lines in <CHIP>U4810</CHIP> with traces broken....pin 1,5,6   0.0v because traces broke.....fix it... now keyboards is working again
thamks you very much
